title: Create ggplot2 charts in the Essential Services Commission of Victoria style
code: library(esctheme) r_setup() ## basic example code  # create a dataset esc_colours <- esc_palette() specie <- c(rep("sorgho" , 4) , rep("poacee" , 4) , rep("banana" , 4) , rep("triticum" , 4)) condition <- rep(c("Normal" , "Stress" , "Nitrogen", "Other") , 4) value <- rnorm(16 , -5 , 15) data <- data.frame(specie,condition,value)   data <- data %>%    dplyr::arrange(specie, rev(value)) %>%    dplyr::group_by(specie) %>%    dplyr::mutate(label_y = cumsum(value)-0.5*value)  # Plot data with ESC style data %>%    ggplot(aes(fill=condition, y=value, x=specie)) +    geom_bar(position="stack", stat="identity") +   scale_fill_manual(values = esc_colours) +   facet_wrap(~condition) +   labs(title = "This is a title",        subtitle = "This is a subtitle") +   esc_theme(rm_y_leg = TRUE)

code: plot_label(   label,   x,   y,   colour = NA,   size = 3.5,   hjust = 0,   geom = c("text", "label"),   angle = 0,   facet_name = NULL,   facet_value = NULL )

title: Add on-graph labels to graphs — plot_label
text: label String vector. Label text displayed. x Numeric string vector. X-axis positions label text. y Numeric string vector. Y-axis positions label text. colour (optional) Vector colour names strings. Default uses e61 palette. size (optional) Integer. Size text, default size appropriate cases. hjust (optional) numeric value 0-1. Adjusts alignment text. 0 left-aligns (default), 0.5 centre-aligns 1 right-aligns. geom (optional) String. Either "text" (default) "label". "label" adds white box around text useful sometimes. angle (optional) Numeric. Rotate labels. Defaults 0 normal left--right text. facet_name, facet_value (optional) String. Specify name facetting variable facet_name panel show labels using facet_value. Defaults NULL shows labels facets. must specify facet_name facet_value leave NULL.
